metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2253 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the `/v2/_catalog` endpoint in distribution/distribution, which accepts a parameter to control the maximum number of records returned (query string: `n`). This vulnerability allows a malicious user to submit an unreasonably large value for `n,` causing the allocation of a massive string array, possibly causing a denial of service through excessive use of memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

docker-registry - 2.7.1+ds2-7ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: docker-registry package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.1+ds2-7ubuntu0.3').
